title: Man killed while crossing intersection in Harvey
content: A man died after being hit by a car Saturday morning (June 2) in Harvey, the Jefferson Parish Sheriff's Office said. The fatality occurred near the intersection of Manhattan Boulevard and Ute Drive. A 63-year-old Harvey man was hit as he crossed the intersection around 4:20 a.m. The driver of a 2009 Nissan Rogue attempted to brake and swerve, but hit the pedestrian with the left front corner of his vehicle. The driver did not appear to be impaired. The investigation so far has found that the fatality is likely the result of the pedestrian violation of failing to yield while crossing the roadway, according to JPSO spokesman Glen Boyd. Authorities sent notice of the wreck at 7:59 a.m.
contentWithMarkup: Fatality reported at Manhattan Boulevard and Ute Drive
